recipe.ingredients: - Cauliflower: 1 head (about 2 pounds, to make 3 cups riced) - Egg: 1 large - Mozzarella cheese (part-skim, shredded): 1/2 cup - Parmesan cheese (grated): 1/4 cup - Italian seasoning: 1 teaspoon - Salt: 1/4 teaspoon - Garlic powder: 1/4 teaspoon - Toppings (sliced bell peppers, onions, mushrooms, spinach): as desired - Tomato sauce (no sugar added): 1/2 cup - Additional mozzarella for topping: 1/2 cup
recipe.directions: 1. Prepare Cauliflower: Wash and dry the cauliflower, then cut off the florets (you don’t need much stem). Pulse in a food processor until you achieve a rice-like texture. 2. Cook Cauliflower: Microwave the riced cauliflower in a bowl for about 4-5 minutes, stir, then let it cool. Once cool, use a clean kitchen towel to squeeze out as much moisture as possible. 3. Make Dough: In a bowl, combine the drained cauliflower with egg, 1/2 cup mozzarella, Parmesan cheese, Italian seasoning, salt, and garlic powder. Mix well to create a dough. 4. Shape and Bake Crust: Preheat oven to 425°F. Spread the dough onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper, and shape into a round pizza crust, about 1/4 inch thick. Bake for 10-15 minutes until golden. 5. Add Toppings: Spread the tomato sauce evenly over the baked crust, then add your desired toppings and additional mozzarella cheese. 6. Bake Pizza: Return to the oven and bake for 10-15 minutes until the toppings are cooked and the cheese is melted and bubbling. 7. Cool and Serve: Let the pizza cool for a few minutes before cutting and serving.
